Text.Page:
Okay, so I may have been a little...dismissive...about the huge pumpkin monster. Sorry about that.

But I just figured out the source of the attacks: Gourdo.

Most of the year, he's a harmless spirit. But come harvest time, he grows in power—and he's always had a knack for summoning. He'll bury us under his minions.

We need to soothe Gourdo somehow. You know...placate the angry spirit, just like any proper ghost story. You know how to placate a spirit?"I'm better at fighting than placating."

At this point, I'll take what help I can get. Keep all the uninvited guests out of the party hall.

If you see Gourdo, disperse him. If you do that, he's next year's problem.

One last thing. Take this—it's a little something for later.

I'm hiring you to be the bouncer at all our parties, . Well, we don't have many parties. Too much study, chores, study, chores...but nevertheless, you're good at keeping the riffraff out.

Since it's Halloween, you deserve a treat! Take this, and feel free to enjoy the party!

Keep the tuwangis away from the candy!

And if you see Gourdo, kick him out. We sure didn't invite him to the party.
